Digital media and marketing software firm Adobe (ADBE) late Tuesday easily beat Wall Street's targets for its fiscal third quarter. The San Jose, Calif.-based company earned an adjusted $3.11 a share on sales of $3.94 billion in the quarter ended Sept. 3. Analysts expected Adobe earnings of $3.01 a share on sales of $3.89 billion, according to FactSet. In the year-earlier period, Adobe earned $2.57 a share on sales of $3.225 billion.https://www.investors.com/news/technology/adbe-stock-adobe-beats-fiscal-q3-targets/?src=A00220

Look at the numbers and you see ADBE beat consensus estimates for both EPS and Revenue. Yet the stock price is down close to 4% here in the AH session and should go down more, for a total deflation of 8% plus, tomorrow during the regular session. Why?? Because the share price today PRIOR to earnings release was pricing in an even BIGGER beat on both baselines. That is why I gave myself a 77-80% chance of success with this trade, and that is why my trading system works so well. The ONLY chance ADBE had to go up on this ER, was for them to deliver absolute blow-out numbers and very strong forward Guidance. The chance of that happening was about 20-23%. So, I win on the trade even though the company delivered a perfectly decent earnings release. :-) Adobe Systems BeatsAdobe Systems (ADBE) reported 3rd Quarter August 2021 earnings of $3.11 per share. The consensus earnings estimate was $3.01 per share on revenue of $3.9 billion. The company said it expects fourth quarter non-GAAP earnings of approximately $3.18 per share on revenue of approximately $4.07 billion. The current consensus earnings estimate is $3.08 per share on revenue of $4.04 billion for the quarter ending November 30, 2021.

Adobe achieved record revenue of $3.94 billion in its third quarter of fiscal year 2021, which represents 22 percent year-over-year growth.GAAP diluted earnings per share was $2.52, representing 28 percent year-over-year growth, and non-GAAP diluted earnings per share was $3.11, representing 21 percent year-over-year growth.Digital Media segment revenue was $2.87 billion, which represents 23 percent year-over-year growth. Creative revenue grew to $2.37 billion, representing 21 percent year-over-year growth. Document Cloud revenue was $493 million, representing 31 percent year-over-year growth.Digital Media Annualized Recurring Revenue (“ARR”) increased $455 million quarter over quarter to $11.67 billion exiting the quarter. Creative ARR grew to $9.87 billion and Document Cloud ARR grew to $1.79 billion.
